Cheesy Cajun Chicken and Sausage Pasta

Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani) is a rich and creamy Indian dish made with marinated chicken cooked in a spiced tomato-based sauce with butter and cream. The chicken is typically grilled or pan-seared before being simmered in a luscious gravy made with tomatoes, butter, garlic, ginger, and aromatic spices like garam masala, cumin, and turmeric. The dish is known for its smooth texture and mildly spiced, slightly sweet flavor. It’s best enjoyed with naan or basmati rice.

Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani) is a rich and creamy Indian dish made with marinated chicken cooked in a spiced tomato-based sauce with butter and cream. The chicken is typically grilled or pan-seared before being simmered in a luscious gravy made with tomatoes, butter, garlic, ginger, and aromatic spices like garam masala, cumin, and turmeric. The dish is known for its smooth texture and mildly spiced, slightly sweet flavor. It’s best enjoyed with naan or basmati rice.

For the Chicken Marinade: 500g boneless chicken (thighs or breast), cut into pieces ½ cup yogurt 1 tbsp lemon juice 1 tsp turmeric 1 tsp red chili powder 1 tsp garam masala 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste Salt to taste For the Butter Chicken Sauce: 2 tbsp butter 1 tbsp oil 1 onion, finely chopped 3 garlic cloves, minced 1-inch ginger, grated 2 tomatoes, pureed 1 tsp cumin 1 tsp coriander powder 1 tsp garam masala ½ tsp chili powder (adjust to taste) ½ cup heavy cream 1 tbsp honey or sugar (optional) 2 tbsp cashew paste (for extra creaminess, optional) Fresh coriander leaves for garnish Instructions: Marinate the Chicken: Mix all marinade ingredients and let the chicken sit for at least 1 hour (overnight for best results). Cook the Chicken: Heat a pan with 1 tbsp oil, cook the marinated chicken until browned, then set aside. Make the Sauce: In the same pan, melt butter and sauté onions until golden. Add garlic and ginger, then cook for 1 minute. Add cumin, coriander, garam masala, and chili powder. Stir for a few seconds before adding the pureed tomatoes. Simmer for 10 minutes until the sauce thickens. Stir in cashew paste (if using). Blend the sauce for a smooth texture (optional). Add cooked chicken, then pour in heavy cream and honey. Simmer for 5 minutes. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with naan or basmati rice.

For the Chicken Marinade: 
500g boneless chicken (thighs or breast), cut into pieces 
½ cup yogurt 
1 tbsp lemon juice 
1 tsp turmeric 
1 tsp red chili powder 
1 tsp garam masala 
1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste 
Salt to taste
 
For the Butter Chicken Sauce:
 
2 tbsp butter
1 tbsp oil 
1 onion, finely chopped 
3 garlic cloves, minced 
1-inch ginger, grated
2 tomatoes, pureed 
1 tsp cumin 
1 tsp coriander powder 
1 tsp garam masala 
½ tsp chili powder (adjust to taste) 
½ cup heavy cream 
1 tbsp honey or sugar (optional) 
2 tbsp cashew paste (for extra creaminess, optional) 
Fresh coriander leaves 

for garnish Instructions:

 Marinate the Chicken:

 Mix all marinade ingredients and let the chicken sit for at least 1 hour (overnight for best results). 
Cook the Chicken: 
Heat a pan with 1 tbsp oil, cook the marinated chicken until browned, then set aside. 
Make the Sauce: In the same pan, melt butter and sauté onions until golden.
Add garlic and ginger, then cook for 1 minute. 
Add cumin, coriander, garam masala, and chili powder. 
Stir for a few seconds before adding the pureed tomatoes.
Simmer for 10 minutes until the sauce thickens. 
Stir in cashew paste (if using). 
Blend the sauce for a smooth texture (optional). 
Add cooked chicken, then pour in heavy cream and honey. 
Simmer for 5 minutes. 
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with naan or basmati rice.
